channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 7
Starting salaries mostly holding steady though a few show drop
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Fresh graduates who become fresh hires this year may find themselves earning less than newbies last year as employers grapple with the effects of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: More bank branches, post offices reopening with safety checks
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Providers of essential services like banks and postal operator Singapore Post are gearing up to resume activities safely post-circuit breaker, with more branches reopening for business.

item.title: Scholarships: It's business as usual for most public and private sector organisations
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Both public and private sector organisations mostly plan to forge ahead with offering scholarship opportunities to promising students, despite greater pressures on public spending and companies' bottom lines due to Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: New players ride the food delivery wave, bringing more choices but also patchy service
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

At least 10 new platforms have leapt onto the food-delivery bandwagon.

item.title: Coronavirus: 97% attendance for those rostered to return to class in Singapore
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Schools in Singapore, from primary to junior college levels, experienced no drop in attendance as they reopened last Tuesday.

item.title: When the price difference of a cake can be as much as $8.50, depending on where you order it
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Buying food from your favourite hawker stall or restaurant has never been easier, thanks to the wealth of food delivery apps and websites available.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ridership doubles after circuit breaker measures eased
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Even as trains and buses became noticeably more crowded on Tuesday after the Covid-19 circuit breaker measures were eased, public transport ridership during the morning rush hour was still at just 36 per cent of the levels prior to the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Organ transplants, donations hit by Covid-19
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

While urgent transplants are allowed, doctors had to make sure the organ is taken from someone who does not have Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Firms in Singapore putting in more safe distancing measures
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Walking into his office at Marina One, Mr Erwin Peter is greeted daily by a temperature-taking robot.

item.title: New normals: Lessons learnt during Covid-19 circuit breaker and what needs to change
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

"A paradigm change in our attitude towards nature and the environment" is what's required, says Prof Koh, pointing out that Covid-19 is a zoonotic disease which came from an animal, probably a bat.

item.title: Coronavirus: SIA must be ready for take-off when global air travel recovers, says its CEO
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

As passenger flights slowly resume, SIA knows it is unlikely to be among the first few carriers to benefit because recovery is expected in the domestic air travel market first.

item.title: Coronavirus: New facility at Changi to house 1,700 more recovering cases
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Changi Exhibition Centre has treated more than 6,000 Covid-19 patients since it was turned into a community care facility about a month ago, with more patients on the way.

item.title: SIA focused on recovery, not retrenchment: CEO
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) has no plans to cut jobs at the moment, said its chief executive, who stressed that the immediate focus is to manage costs and press on with various transformation initiatives.

item.title: ST Engineering Aerospace's US subsidiary suffers massive data breach
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore-based ST Engineering Aerospace's United States subsidiary has suffered a massive ransomware attack, resulting in the exposure of confidential data such as contract details with various governments, government-related organisations and airlines.

item.title: Singapore Airlines rolling out a host of measures to reassure travellers
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

By the end of next month, travellers flying on Singapore Airlines (SIA) will be able to use their mobile phones to operate check-in kiosks at Changi Airport to print boarding passes and bag tags.

item.title: Man killed in accident on CTE
Scoot passengers will not be allowed to choose seats
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Scoot passengers are no longer allowed to pay to choose their seats.

item.title: What lies ahead for the Class of Covid-19?
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Meet the class of 2020 - the young people who have stumbled into a recession brought on by a global pandemic.

item.title: Singapore reports 25th death from Covid-19 complications
item.description:
June 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A 41-year-old male Chinese national who recovered from the coronavirus has died from complications, more than two weeks after being discharged.
